title: 27 Good Gaming Memes That Are Actually Cat Memes Who Wish For a Paws-Friendly Keyboard
description: Heya, gamers and cat pawrents who are one and the same! We're here to give you a small break, you can actually camp here for a while and no one will get mad at you. It's a spot so purrfect for any cat pawrent who likes to game, it's a spot for you to kek and for some cat shenanigans in meme form. Get out of your high DPS mindset and unwind with us here, in the home-base of online cat comedy. We gathered a very special collection of cat memes - it is tailored for all you late-night gamers, who game when your cat is sprawled on your lap.This isn't a DLC, you can incorporate this cat-gaming hybrid meme break, just like any game genre hybridization. Your cat-gaming meme break can be a little puzzle-adventure, but it can also be casual-RPG. Sometimes, with cats being cats, it can be a little action-FPS - but that's okay, because cats will be cats, and this is exactly why we love them.
author: Ayala Sorotsky
excerpt: 27 Good Gaming Memes That Are Actually Cat Memes Who Wish For a Paws-Friendly Keyboard - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: If you're a Millennial gamer, and even a Gen-Xer, this is you. We're sure of it, because this is exactly us. Each of our team members (our pawrecious party of cat-meme adventurers) remembers themselves doing this with many different games: Baldur's Gate, Rage of Mages, The Bard's Tale, and Fallout, just to name a few. Now, that we know them by heart, we all play nostalgia runs with our cats on our laps. We all know games aren't violent, at least not inherently. Especially if there are cats involved. We cat pawrents who game know this. And honestly? The same way we'd like people to stop believing stigmas about cats (they cannot love, they're aloof and they don't care about you, etc.) - we'd also like people to stop believing stigmas about games (they make you do violence, they're bad for your brain, etc.)
html:
If you're a Millennial gamer, and even a Gen-Xer, this is you. We're sure of it, because this is exactly us. Each of our team members (our pawrecious party of cat-meme adventurers) remembers themselves doing this with many different games: Baldur's Gate, Rage of Mages, The Bard's Tale, and Fallout, just to name a few. Now, that we know them by heart, we all play nostalgia runs with our cats on our laps.

We all know games aren't violent, at least not inherently. Especially if there are cats involved. We cat pawrents who game know this. And honestly? The same way we'd like people to stop believing stigmas about cats (they cannot love, they're aloof and they don't care about you, etc.) - we'd also like people to stop believing stigmas about games (they make you do violence, they're bad for your brain, etc.)
